thread.title: USC AD Pat Haden 'fine,' flies home after lightheadedness at Notre Dame game
thread.title_full: USC AD Pat Haden 'fine,' flies home after lightheadedness at Notre Dame game

author: Bob Hille
title: USC AD Pat Haden 'fine,' flies home after lightheadedness at Notre Dame game
text:
USC AD Pat Haden 'fine,' flies home after lightheadedness at Notre Dame game Sporting News 48 mins ago Bob Hille USC athletic director Pat Haden, who visited a local hospital after becoming lightheaded on the sideline before the Trojans' 41-31 loss at Notre Dame, was well enough to fly home to Los Angeles late Saturday night, the Los Angeles Times reported .
AdChoices A USC spokesman described Haden, 62, as being “fine” and he was resting comfortably before departing on a private plane.
MORE: Five things we learned from USC's loss to Notre Dame
Haden initially felt lightheaded on the sideline and was forced to take a knee before being tended to by first-aid staff at Notre Dame Stadium.
The game was USC's first since Haden fired coach Steve Sarkisian . The AD has been criticized for his handling of Sarkisian, who has entered outpatient rehab for alcohol-use issues.
However, Haden has received a vote of confidence from USC president Max Nikias.
